18 from ...common.io_objects import PinMode, NiryoIO
19 
20 
21 class FakeDigitalIO(NiryoIO):
22  def __init__(self, name, mode):
23  super(FakeDigitalIO, self).__init__(None, None, name)
24 
25  assert mode in [PinMode.DIGITAL_OUTPUT, PinMode.DIGITAL_INPUT], \
26  "The pin mode of a fake digital io must be either PinMode.ANALOG_INPUT or PinMode.ANALOG_OUTPUT"
27 
28  self._mode = mode
29  self._value = 0
30 
31  @property
32  def value(self):
33  return self._value
34 
35  @value.setter
36  def value(self, value):
37  assert isinstance(value, (bool, int, float))
38  limited_value = max(0, min(int(value), 1))
39  self._value = bool(limited_value)
40 
41  @property
42  def mode(self):
43  return self._mode
44 
45  @mode.setter
46  def mode(self, mode):
47  assert mode in [PinMode.DIGITAL_OUTPUT, PinMode.DIGITAL_INPUT], \
48  "The pin mode of a fake digital io must be either PinMode.ANALOG_INPUT or PinMode.ANALOG_OUTPUT"
49 
50  if mode != self._mode:
51  self._value = 0
52  self._mode = mode
